text: Dark yellow brown lasting tan beige foam. Aroma rye bread intense. Tastes German rye bread, caramel, licorice. Robust savory roasts. Dry palate. This is old so the hops have faded into a perfumy, tobacco orange.

Its good with the British malts and the American hops are somewhat restrained, but there are a few off qualities. And I dont understand the purpose of these hops for this style of beer. Just not as good as Id expected.

Henrik 060914. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is hop, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, caramel. Flavour is roasted malt, caramel, citrus, grapefruit, hop, chocolate, coffee. Easy drinkable nice beer.

Draught @ Henrik Øl og Vinstove, Bergen
Pours clear dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus and grape. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long caramel and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap at Henriks. A murky brown beer topped by a small, beige head. The aroma is roasted and quite hoppy, with chocolate and coffee. Roasted flavor with a nice hoppy bitterness and citrus peel. Hints of licorice. Full body, soft carbonation. Lasting roasted finish with a nice bitterness and grapefruit. Quite tasteful and pleasant this one. 140616

Keg @ Holy Grale. Slightly hazy brown with a small white head. String rosin and caramel-covered potpourri. Pretty unique aroma. Taste is less fragrant. Brown sugar Nd coffee. Lavender flowers.
Smoked herb. Light body, soft carb. Good.

Bottle at home. Pours clear dark brown with a large, creamy and frothy beige head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is toast and nutty malt, dates, earthy and spicy hops with light alcohol notes. Flavor is moderate hops and heavy bitterness, lightly sweet malt, dates and figs with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Dark brown pour with a light brown head. Aroma Is roasted malt, nutty. Taste is roasted malt, little chalky, nice malty backbone. Very tasty enjoyable beer. Need to buy more. Great lacing.
Aroma is malts, spices and pine/juniper berries. The flavor is malts, fruit, mild sugar sweetness and a mix of citrus hops and tangy in the finish.

In short: A malty nutty brown ale with a generous refreshing fruity hopping. My type of beer.
How: Bottle 500ml, consumed a few weeks after purchase, however fresh this Danish beer can be in a Vermont store.
The look: Cloudy brown body topped by a large beige head with medium retention.
In long: Nose is an inviting blend of citrusy hops over a layer of cashews and hazelnuts. In mouth the beer offers a rather corpulent body for a 6% brew with plenty of carbonation. Creamy cake malts, hazelnuts, dense whole-wheat bread, cashews, cacao. That solid nutty malt backbone is almost dominated by the refreshing citrusy hops (grapefruits, others). I love hoppy brown ale, Id like it to become a trend like Black IPAs or the more recent trend of White IPAs. This Autumnic Fallout is a very good example on how the harmoniously match a fat creamy nutty malt backbone with a sharp fruity IPA hopping. Looks like I appreciated this beer more than most people here, and I may rate beers against the grain but I never said I was better than everybody else here (I think it all the time but never said it).

50cl, 2012 vintage. Large beige head atop hazy dark brown body, nice lacing. Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, some bread, light earthy/orange, nut. Taste is moderately sweet, orange/earthy, some caramel, nut, light spicy. Medium body, low carbonation, light stickiness.
Bottle from Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours dark brown with a 3-finger tan head and a smoky malt aroma. There is a full-bodied malt and coffee flavor with a bitter slightly citric finish. A nice brew.

Ambery brown colour with a small fluffy off-white head. Aroma is wood, herbs, some sweet malts, nuts as well as some slight toasted notes. Flavour is sweet caramel malts, nuttyness, mild spices, wood and herbal notes along with a quite biting floral and grassy bitterness towards the finish.

Bottle from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours dark brown with a foamy 3 finger light tan head. Aroma is hoppy underlaid by something suggesting funk. Med + body. Flavor has a bit of chocolate, lots of mixed hop. As it flows away, it goes less chocolate, fairly earthy, and maybe yet a bit funky. Funky. Earthy. Who can tell? Finishes dry, bitter, tasty.

On tap at Henrik, Bergen. Pours a murky mahogany brown body with a small off-white head. Nose is caramel, brown grainy malt tones, citric fresh hops and hints of grass and bread dough. Taste is the rather odd, but very assertive and pleasant combination of American peachy-fruity hops and brown malts: caramel, peaches, melon, hints of grass, licorice, grapefruit and chocolate. Medium body and carbonation. Nice.

Pours deep mahogany into an English pint. Tan head with excellent retention craters and recedes leaving gloppy lacing. Dark resin and caramel aromas. Dry with sweet caramel upfront turning quickly to bread, chocolate and resin in the lasting earthy bitter finish.

Tap. Pours clear amber/brown with a small beige head leaving a fair lacing. Caramel aroma with brown sugar, wood and a nice touch of hops. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and pleasant bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A very nice brown.

Brown ale är någon av mina favoritsorter men det här kan mycket väl ha varit den bästa brown alen jag någonsin druckit. Smaken var maltig och söt med en underbar balans. Slutsats: seriöst bra brown ale.
Bottle from State Line. Pours brown with tan brown head. Nose and taste of roasted brown malt, cocoa, grapefruit find and nutty malt. Medium body. Finishes slightly bitter grapefruit/nutty roast.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Halmtorvet 29 c, Copenhagen, Denmark 1700.Unclear medium to dark amber colour with a average, frothy - fizzy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, caramel, pale roasted - toasted, moderate hoppy, citrus, orange - citrus. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, caramel, hoppy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130107]

On tap @ Henrik. This is a heavy cloudy deep brown one with a small light beige soft sidesticking top. Its quite candy sweet on the aroma. Some traces of chocolate and cocoa and its lovely fruit-hoppy. On the carbonation its spot on average and the mouthfeel is soft oily. Lovely cocoa and chocolate flavors and its really fresh and hoppy. This is one of those you can drink loads and loads of without being tired off it. Highly recommended by a Palme. 16.02.2013

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen (Beer Here tap takeover) - dark amber to brown in colour. Caramel malts and nutty nuances, brown sugar, good mouthfeel, liked this.
On tap at Cookie. Malty and spicy. Aromas of caramel, anisette, nuts, and grain. Taste is sweet and spicy with long length. Palate is velvety. Brown with a frothy head.

200ml from the great tap menu at Crowbar & Bryggeri. Unclear dark brown with a rustic shade. Near-naked surface, spotty lacing. Aroma of roasted malts joined by liquorice. Malt-fruity taste spiced with aniseed carefully balanced by bitter roast malts. Medium bodied. Good drinking (Oslo, 22.02.2013).

Bottle. Mahogony beer with a tan head. Malt and light citrus aroma with light caramel. Caramel and light toffee flavor with light cocoa. Medium bodied. Caramel and light toffee lingers with light cocoa.

Draft. Pours clear dark copper with a heavy lacing creamy beige thick head. Aroma is quite hoppy with herbal and citric hops, nutty, caramel, roasted malt and red apple. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. 
Body is medium, texture is medium creamy, carbonation is average. Finish is long, hoppy with a lot of red ripe apple and some malty bitterness. Quite accomplished in a lot of ways.

A fantastic beer from one of my all time favorite brewers. Firm, clean, deep and perfectly balanced. In my book a modern brown ale is hard to execute,   it takes a solid brewer to make me reverent over a style like this.
Fairbar, Aarhus, DK. Tap, 110113. Brown with beige head. Aroma of malt and spices. Flavour with nuts and ripe fruit
Draught. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Dark amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Draft @ Söder Om Småland, Malmö. Pours a dark brown color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty hoppy piney aroma. Fruity slightly roasted malty hoppy flavor with weak hints of licorice. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish.
Tap @ Ølbaren. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are rich nuts, caramel, notes of chocolate, roast malt and hops. Nice dry finish.

Draught at Ølbaren, CopenhagenDark brown color, with medium sized creamy head. A very nice beer, elegant and balanced, with roasted malt and hop aroma, roasted malt and chocolate flavor, quite dry, dynamic; there is a trace of star anise and other spices; the roasty character in the end is just a tad too much for me.Very well brewed.
On tap. Aroma discreet, roasted malt and caramelled dark sugars. Taste full , malty, balanced. Same tastes as in aroma. Good.
Dark chestnut colour with a lasting off-white head. Malty aroma with caramel and dark sugars. Sweet malty flavour with plenty caramel and a mild hoppy finish
Anche qui luppolo non pervenuto, birra sbilanciata, non lho gradita affatto.

(Draught at Bishops Arms Folkungagatan, Stockholm) Dark brown colour with foamy, beige head. Roasted, hoppy nose with dark bread, ryvita, orange peel and a touch of pine needles. Malty, hoppy taste with notes of dark bread, dark fruit, raisins, prunes, orange peel and a balanced bitterness in a fairly dry finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Very nice and tasty.
On tap @macche. Not so impressive in my opinion, with respect to other Beer Here beers that are fantastic. Fruity aroma with hop and malt taste.
Tap @ fermentoren. Pours unclear Brown with a small Brown head. Bread, caramel, dark malts and US hops. Smooth, dry and bitter. Lovely!
Malty nose. Fruit and melasses. Looks really tasty in tumbler. Dark but not black. Hoppy bitterness, also in the aftertaste.

On tap. Clear, warm reddish brown with a creamy, beige head leaving laces. Sweet burned caramel in the nose combined with fairly aromatic hops. Full-bodied, sweet caramel and brown sugars, a little woody as well and again these pleasant aroma hops. Bitter finish. Neat. 261012

Draught @ BA Linnégatan. Pours dark amber/brown with a small off white head. Hoppy, straight forward aroma. Taste is a bit schizo with notes of dark burned malts and chocolate on one hand and a crisp hoppiness on the other. Not entirely in balance. The clash between the malts and hops creates a "thin" feel for a 6% ABV beer. Still drinkable and refreshing.

Draught at Bishops Linnégatan.
Pours coffee brown with a tan head.
Fresh hoppy aroma.
Sweet taste of citrusy hops and some dark fruit and milk chocolate. Would have guessed that it was a brown ale rather than amber.
Draught at Bishop Arma, Copenhagen. Hazy brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, malt and hops.

Tap @ Fairbar. Pours hazy dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma of malt, hops, grapefruit, light pine.Flavor is malt, light caramel, fruity hops, grapefruit, pine. Medium body, soft carbonation, lasting bitter finish. 121012

Dark brown with small light tan head. Aroma is a nice mix between roasted malt, cherries and pine hops, with some hints of citrus and grapefruit. Taste is roasted bitter with the hops clearly coming through, finish mostly a roasted coffee kind of bitter. Slightly too light-bodied, but refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown ?mall lite Brown head flowery quite bitter hoppy flavor is dark maly flowery hoppy  new mobile

Tap @ Ørsted Ølbar, Cph. Pours deep dark amber with a small, film head. Aroma has lovely pine, dark fruit, grapefruit, light peach. Low to medium carbonation, fine creamy and light dry mouthfeel. Flavour is elegant, toasted caramel, fruity, grapefruit,  red apple, kinda chewy. Lingering bitterness. Lovely balanced.

From tap at Ørsted Ølbar. Pours murky brown with a small white head. Aroma is mild fruity and citrusy, crisp hoppy. Bitter, citrusy and crisp hoppy. Smooth peachy and grapefruity. Lingering hoppy, light greasy and peachy to citrusy.

Draft. A dark brown beer with a lazing tan head. The aroma has notes of hops, citrus fruit, spices, caramel, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of toffee, citrus fruits, malt, and spicy hops, leading to a bitter finish.
Tap @ FairBar. Very dark amber/brown with tiny off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, caramel and citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, caramel, little sweet, citrus, pine and medium bitter.

Cask at Bishops Arms.
Cloudy red-brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Fruity and light roasted aroma of caramel, hops and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, grass and caramel with notes of chocolate.
Dry hoppy finish.

Tap @ Fairbar, Aarhus. Unclear dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, notes of roasted malt and rather hoppy - pine and grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. High drinkability. 121012

Chopp. Quite hazy dark brown colour, medium beige head. Hoppy fruity citrus toasty malty aroma. Good mouthfeel. Flavour of well toasted malt, fruity hops and citrus with caramel and a good well lasting bitterness.

Draught at Ørsted Ølbar. Clear dark brown - offwhite head. Sweet malty. Fruity. Nutty. Red berries. Nice hoppy. High malty. Light Bread. Nice tobacco taste. Nice balance. Light oiley hoppy. Very pleasant fruity and bitter finish.

Draught at Ørsted Ølbar. Slighty unclear reddish brown with a small beige head. Lovely aroma, very hoppy with a bready, nutty backbone. Hoppy accents of Simcoe, grapefruity, herbal, spicy with citrusy notes. Flavor is wellbalanced, malty, fruity, hoppy, with a harsh yet medium bitter finish, leaving rustic notes of black tea and a faint taste of coffee. Perfectly fit for autumn, but I could honestly drink a beer like this all year round.
